note.note-paragraph: The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups: - A43B21/10-A43B21/16 covered by A43B21/06 - A43B21/34 covered by A43B21/24

CPC-specific-text.text: Footwear made at least partially of alveolar or honeycomb material
Footwear made at least partially of flexible, bellow-like shaped material
Footwear made at least partially from a material having special colours
with fluorescent or phosforescent parts
Footwear made at least partially of deodorant means
Footwear provided with magnets, magnetic parts or magnetic substances
Footwear made at least partially of material that can be recycled
Footwear made at least partially of transparent or translucent materials
Footwear made at least partially of hook-and-loop type material

by lifting the insole

having an anatomical or curved form
characterised by the location under the foot

situated under the ball of the foot, i.e. the joint between the first metatarsal and first phalange

situated under the toes, i.e. the phalange
with special properties
provided with acupressure points or means for footmassage
with removable or adjustable pads to allow custom fit
for sick or disabled persons, e.g. persons having osteoarthritis or diabetes

Recesses or holes filled with a support or pad
Recesses or holes, traversing partially or completely the thickness of the pad
